content.webTitle: GOP's healthcare plan: we'll get back to you

fields.headline: GOP's healthcare plan: we'll get back to you
fields.bodyText: Senate Republicans this week will take their “first steps” to dismantle Barack Obama’s health care law and will produce an alternative “soon”, majority leader Mitch McConnell said. He did not elaborate on “soon”. How soon is soon? The three-term Alabama senator Jeff Sessions, Donald Trump’s nominee for US attorney general, will on Tuesday be forced to defend a career dogged by claims of racism and bigotry, as Senate hearings begin. Delay Trump’s cabinet hearings Democrats borrow rules for nominees from GOP It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest campaign news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please consider joining us by becoming a member for only $6.99 a month. Thanks for reading! Become a Guardian member “There was one performance this year that stunned me,” actress Meryl Streep told her Golden Globes audience at the weekend. “It sank its hooks in my heart. Not because it was good; there was nothing good about it. But it was effective and it did its job...” Streep gets Trump Trump transition team officials told the Associated Press, on condition of anonymity, that Trump’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner, will be named to an official White House role this week. Kushner, 35, will need to argue that a federal anti-nepotism law does not apply to him. Kushner to be named
